meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Hepatitis Linked to Scallions Contaminated scallions were almost certainly the cause of a large outbreak of hepatitis A in Western Pennsylvania, federal health officials said.
New Tape in Sniper Trial In an audiotaped confession, Lee Malvo, the 18-year-old suspect in the Washington sniper killings, let go with giggles and belly laughs as he described the attacks.
Hepatitis Linked to Scallions Contaminated scallions were almost certainly the cause of a large outbreak of hepatitis A in Western Pennsylvania, federal health officials said.
New Tape in Sniper Trial In an audiotaped confession, Lee Malvo, the 18-year-old suspect in the Washington sniper killings, let go with giggles and belly laughs as he described the attacks.
Pulitizer Prize Will Stand The Pulitzer Prize board said it would not revoke a 1932 prize to Walter Duranty of The New York Times for discredited articles about the Soviet Union.
The Mutant in the Pet Shop A Texas company said that it would soon start selling what it called a ''miracle of science,'' a genetically engineered aquarium fish that glows in the dark.
